intro: Tithymalus pyrenaeus, commonly known as the Pyrenean tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations above 1,000 meters. It is a perennial herb that thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
